meanings.definition: Having a soft, moist, and fleshy texture.
meanings.sent1: The ripe peach was pulpous to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The orange was juicy and pulpous when squeezed.
meanings.sent3: The pulpous watermelon made a squishy sound when bitten into.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned a pulpous shade of pink from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The pulpous sponge soaked up all the spilled water.

meanings.sent1: The pulpous paper was easy to tear.
meanings.sent2: The pulpous mixture looked like a thick paste.
meanings.sent3: The pulpous book pages stuck together after getting wet.
meanings.sent4: The pulpous clouds in the sky resembled cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The pulpous apple sauce had a smooth and thick texture.

meanings.sent1: The pulpous tomato was perfect for making sauce.
meanings.sent2: The pulpous texture of the mashed potatoes was comforting.
meanings.sent3: The pulpous banana peel slipped out of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The pulpous mud squished between her toes as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The pulpous pumpkin pie filling was rich and delicious.
